title: Vertex Form
text: The vertex of a quadratic can be easily identified when the quadratic is in the standard vertex form of $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$

title: Identifying Vertex
text: From standard vertex form, the vertex is given by (h,k).

title: Negative Signs
text: Note that in the vertex form, the term being squared has the value of $$h$$ subtracting $$x$$.
